intro: Apetlothamnus, commonly known as the desert holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their spiny stems and small, often clustered leaves. They produce small, usually green or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences.
